content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function that you requested:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Maecenas ultricies nisl ut varius luctus. Sed vitae purus malesuada, sollicitudin mi id, dictum dui."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This example will output the wrapped text with new lines at the appropriate places.
